meanings.definition: Not involving or relating to writing or written symbols.
meanings.sent1: The agraphic painting was filled with abstract shapes and colors.
meanings.sent2: The agraphic presentation focused solely on spoken explanations.
meanings.sent3: The agraphic instructions confused the students who were used to written guides.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked in agraphic patterns, seeing the world in emotions rather than words.
meanings.sent5: The agraphic design of the room made it feel spacious and open.

meanings.definition: Lacking the ability to create or understand graphic representations.
meanings.sent1: The agraphic student struggled with interpreting charts and diagrams.
meanings.sent2: His agraphic mind found it challenging to visualize complex concepts.
meanings.sent3: The agraphic artist humorously drew stick figures in their illustrations.
meanings.sent4: Her agraphic imagination painted pictures with words instead of images.
meanings.sent5: The agraphic child preferred storytelling over picture books.

meanings.definition: Describing a person who is unable to produce written language.
meanings.sent1: The agraphic writer dictated their stories instead of writing them down.
meanings.sent2: The agraphic individual communicated through gestures and expressions.
meanings.sent3: The agraphic student relied on audio recordings for note-taking.
meanings.sent4: Her agraphic condition led her to explore the world through touch and sound.
meanings.sent5: The agraphic poet crafted verses that painted vivid scenes in the mind.
